entities.title: Peder Griffenfeld
entities.description: Count Peder Griffenfeld was a Danish statesman and royal favourite. He became the principal adviser to King Christian V of Denmark from 1670 and the de facto ruler of the dual kingdom of Denmark-Norway in the first half of the 1670s. In 1673 he was appointed as Chancellor of Denmark, elevated to count, the highest aristocratic rank in Denmark-Norway, and received the Order of the Elephant, the cou

heading: Births
txt: Sir Robert Munro, 6th Baronet, British politician (d. 1746)

entities.title: Sir Robert Munro, 6th Baronet
entities.description: Sir Robert Munro of Foulis, 6th Baronet was a soldier-politician whose life followed an 18th-century pattern. He fought in support of the Revolution Settlement and the House of Hanover, and their opposition to all attempts by the Jacobites to restore the House of Stuart either by force of arms or by political intrigue.

heading: Births
txt: Alaungpaya, Burmese king (d. 1760)

entities.title: Alaungpaya
entities.description: Alaungpaya was the founder of the Konbaung Dynasty of Burma (Myanmar). By the time of his death from illness during his campaign in Siam, this former chief of a small village in Upper Burma had unified Burma, subdued Manipur, conquered Lan Na and defeated the French and the British who had given help to the Restored Hanthawaddy Kingdom. He added settlements around Dagon, and called the enlarged to

heading: Births
txt: Peter Ernst Wilde, German physician and journalist (d. 1785)

entities.title: Peter Ernst Wilde
entities.description: Peter Ernst Wilde was a Baltic German physician and Enlightenment era Estophile.

heading: Births
txt: Duchess Sophia Frederica of Mecklenburg-Schwerin (d. 1794)

entities.title: Duchess Sophia Frederica of Mecklenburg-Schwerin
entities.description: Sophia Frederica of Mecklenburg-Schwerin was a Princess and Duchess of Mecklenburg-Schwerin, and by marriage Hereditary Princess of Denmark and Norway.

heading: Births
txt: William Wilberforce, English philanthropist and politician (d. 1833)

entities.title: William Wilberforce
entities.description: William Wilberforce was a British politician, philanthropist, and a leader of the movement to abolish the slave trade. A native of Kingston upon Hull, Yorkshire, he began his political career in 1780, eventually becoming an independent Member of Parliament (MP) for Yorkshire (1784–1812). In 1785, he became an evangelical Christian, which resulted in major changes to his lifestyle and a lifelong co

heading: Births
txt: William I of the Netherlands (d. 1840)

entities.title: William I of the Netherlands
entities.description: William I was a Prince of Orange, the King of the Netherlands and Grand Duke of Luxembourg.

heading: Births
txt: James Weddell, Belgian-English sailor, hunter, and explorer (d. 1834)

entities.title: James Weddell
entities.description: James Weddell was a British sailor, navigator and seal hunter who in February 1823 sailed to latitude of 74° 15′ S—a record 7.69 degrees or 532 statute miles south of the Antarctic Circle—and into a region of the Southern Ocean that later became known as the Weddell Sea.

heading: Births
txt: Antonio Stoppani, Italian geologist and scholar (d. 1891)

entities.title: Antonio Stoppani
entities.description: Antonio Stoppani was an Italian Catholic priest, patriot, geologist and palaeontologist. He studied the geology of the Italian region and wrote a popular treatise, Il Bel Paese, on geology and natural history. He was among the first to propose a geological epoch dominated by human activities that altered the shape of the land.

heading: Births
txt: Théodore Dubois, French organist, composer, and educator (d. 1924)

entities.title: Théodore Dubois
entities.description: François-Clément Théodore Dubois was a French composer, organist, and music teacher.

heading: Births
txt: Boyd Dunlop Morehead, Australian politician, 10th Premier of Queensland (d. 1905)

entities.title: Boyd Dunlop Morehead
entities.description: Boyd Dunlop Morehead was a politician in Queensland, Australia. He was Premier of Queensland from November 1888 to June 1890.

entities.title: Premier of Queensland
entities.description: The Premier of Queensland is the head of government in the Australian state of Queensland.

heading: Births
txt: James Calhoun, American lieutenant (d. 1876)

entities.title: James Calhoun (soldier)
entities.description: James Calhoun was a soldier in the United States Army during the American Civil War and the Black Hills War. He was the brother-in-law of George Armstrong Custer and was killed along with Custer in the Battle of the Little Bighorn. His brother-in-law Myles Moylan survived the battle as part of the forces with Major Marcus Reno and Captain Frederick Benteen.

heading: Births
txt: Tom Kendall, Australian cricketer and journalist (d. 1924)

entities.title: Tom Kendall
entities.description: Thomas Kingston Kendall was an Australian cricketer, who played in two Test matches in 1877, including the inaugural Test which was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground in March 1877.

heading: Births
txt: David Bowman, Australian lawyer and politician (d. 1916)

entities.title: David Bowman (politician)
entities.description: David Bowman was a Labor politician in the Legislative Assembly of Queensland and Queensland Leader of the Opposition from 1908 to 1912.

heading: Births
txt: Zonia Baber, American geographer and geologist (d. 1956)

entities.title: Zonia Baber
entities.description: Zonia Baber, born Mary Arizona Baber in Clark County, Illinois, was an American geographer and geologist best known for developing methods for teaching geography. Her teachings emphasized experiential learning through field work and experimentation.

heading: Births
txt: Dragutin Lerman, Croatian explorer (d. 1918)

entities.title: Dragutin Lerman
entities.description: Dragutin Lerman was a Croatian explorer.

heading: Births
txt: Ferdinand I of Romania (d. 1927)

entities.title: Ferdinand I of Romania
entities.description: Ferdinand, nicknamed Întregitorul, was the second King of Romania from 1914 until his death in 1927. Ferdinand was the second son of Leopold, Prince of Hohenzollern and Infanta Antónia of Portugal, daughter of Ferdinand II of Portugal and Maria II of Portugal. His family was part of the Catholic branch of the Prussian royal family Hohenzollern.

heading: Births
txt: Max Beerbohm, English essayist, parodist, and caricaturist (d. 1956)

entities.title: Max Beerbohm
entities.description: Sir Henry Maximilian "Max" Beerbohm was an English essayist, parodist and caricaturist under the signature Max. He first became known in the 1890s as a dandy and a humorist. He was the drama critic for the Saturday Review from 1898 until 1910, when he relocated to Rapallo, Italy. In his later years he was popular for his occasional radio broadcasts. Among his best-known works is his only novel, Zu

heading: Births
txt: Earl Derr Biggers, American author and playwright (d. 1933)

entities.title: Earl Derr Biggers
entities.description: Earl Derr Biggers was an American novelist and playwright. His novels featuring the fictional Chinese American detective Charlie Chan were adapted into popular films made in the United States and China.

heading: Births
txt: Harry Hooper, American baseball player (d. 1974)

entities.title: Harry Hooper
entities.description: Harry Bartholomew Hooper was a Major League Baseball (MLB) right fielder in the early 20th century. Hooper batted left-handed and threw right-handed. Hooper was born in Bell Station, California, and he graduated from Saint Mary's College of California. He played for major league teams between 1909 and 1925, spending most of that time with the Boston Red Sox and finishing his career with the Chicag

heading: Births
txt: Valentine Baker, Welsh co-founder of the Martin-Baker Aircraft Company (d. 1942)

entities.title: Valentine Baker (pilot)
entities.description: Captain Valentine Henry Baker MC AFC, nicknamed "Bake", served in all three of the British Armed Forces during the First World War. After the war he became a civilian flight instructor, and co-founder of the Martin-Baker Aircraft Company. He was the father of novelist Denys Val Baker.

entities.title: Martin-Baker
entities.description: Martin-Baker Aircraft Co. Ltd. is a British manufacturer of ejection seats and safety-related equipment for aviation. The company's origins were originally as an aircraft manufacturer before becoming a pioneer in the field of ejection seats. The company's headquarters are in Higher Denham, Buckinghamshire, England with other sites in France, Italy and the United States.

heading: Births
txt: Duke Kahanamoku, American swimmer, actor, and surfer (d. 1968)

entities.title: Duke Kahanamoku
entities.description: Duke Paoa Kahinu Mokoe Hulikohola Kahanamoku was an American and Native Hawaiian competition swimmer who popularized the ancient Hawaiian sport of surfing. He was born towards the end of the Kingdom of Hawaii, just before the overthrow, living into statehood as a United States citizen. He was a five-time Olympic medalist in swimming. Duke was also a Scottish Rite Freemason, a Shriner, a law enforc

heading: Births
txt: Jean Rhys, Dominican-English novelist (d. 1979)

heading: Births
txt: Haim Ernst Wertheimer, German-Israeli biochemist and academic (d. 1978)

entities.title: Haim Ernst Wertheimer
entities.description: Haim Ernst Wertheimer was an Israeli biochemist.

heading: Births
txt: Richard Cushing, American cardinal (d. 1970)

entities.title: Richard Cushing
entities.description: Richard James Cushing was an American prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He served as Archbishop of Boston from 1944 to 1970 and was made a cardinal in 1958. Cushing's main role was as fundraiser and builder of new churches, schools, and institutions. Unlike his predecessor, he was on good terms with practically the entire Boston elite, as he softened the traditional confrontation between the C

heading: Births
txt: Fred Rose, American pianist, songwriter, and publisher (d. 1954)

entities.title: Fred Rose (songwriter)
entities.description: Knowles Fred Rose was an American musician, Hall of Fame songwriter, and music publishing executive.

heading: Births
txt: Malcolm Cowley, American novelist, poet, literary critic  (d. 1989)

entities.title: Malcolm Cowley
entities.description: Malcolm Cowley was an American writer, editor, historian, poet, and literary critic. His best known works include his first book of poetry, Blue Juniata (1929), his lyrical memoir, Exile's Return, as a chronicler and fellow traveller of the Lost Generation, and as an influential editor and talent scout at Viking Press.

heading: Births
txt: Jorge Luis Borges, Argentine short-story writer, essayist, poet and translator (d. 1986)

entities.title: Jorge Luis Borges
entities.description: Jorge Francisco Isidoro Luis Borges Acevedo was an Argentine short-story writer, essayist, poet and translator, and a key figure in Spanish-language and universal literature. His best-known books, Ficciones (Fictions) and El Aleph, published in the 1940s, are compilations of short stories interconnected by common themes, including dreams, labyrinths, philosophers, libraries, mirrors, fictional wri

heading: Births
txt: Albert Claude, Belgian biologist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 1983)

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Births
txt: Gaylord DuBois, American author and poet (d. 1993)

heading: Births
txt: Preston Foster, American actor (d. 1970)

entities.title: Preston Foster
entities.description: Preston Stratton Foster, was an American actor of stage, film, radio, and television, whose career spanned nearly four decades. He also had a career as a vocalist.

heading: Births
txt: Fernand Braudel, French historian and academic (d. 1985)

entities.title: Fernand Braudel
entities.description: Fernand Braudel was a French historian and a leader of the Annales School. His scholarship focused on three main projects: The Mediterranean, Civilization and Capitalism (1955–79), and the unfinished Identity of France (1970–85). His reputation stems in part from his writings, but even more from his success in making the Annales School the most important engine of historical research in France and

heading: Births
txt: Carlo Gambino, Italian-American mob boss (d. 1976)

heading: Births
txt: Karl Hanke, German businessman and politician (d. 1945)

entities.title: Karl Hanke
entities.description: Karl August Hanke was an official of the Nazi Party (NSDAP) during its rule over Germany and served as the fifth and last Reichsführer of the Schutzstaffel (SS). He also served as Gauleiter of Gau Lower Silesia from 1941 to 1945 and as Oberpräsident of the Prussian Province of Lower Silesia. Captured on 6 May 1945, he was shot and killed by Czech partisans on 8 June.

heading: Births
txt: Ida Cook, English campaigner for Jewish refugees, and romantic novelist as Mary Burchell (d. 1986)

entities.title: Ida Cook
entities.description: Ida Cook was a British campaigner for Jewish refugees and a romance novelist as Mary Burchell.

heading: Births
txt: Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (d. 1974)

entities.title: Arthur Crudup
entities.description: Arthur William "Big Boy" Crudup was an American Delta blues singer, songwriter and guitarist. He is best known, outside blues circles, for his songs "That's All Right" (1946), "My Baby Left Me" and "So Glad You're Mine", later recorded by Elvis Presley and other artists.

heading: Births
txt: Siaka Stevens, Sierra Leonean police officer and politician, 1st President of Sierra Leone (d. 1988)

entities.title: President of Sierra Leone
entities.description: The president of the Republic of Sierra Leone is the head of state and the head of government of Sierra Leone, as well as the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces.

heading: Births
txt: Bruno Giacometti, Swiss architect, designed the Hallenstadion (d. 2012)

entities.title: Bruno Giacometti
entities.description: Bruno Giacometti was a Swiss architect and the brother of the artists Alberto and Diego Giacometti. He was among the most notable post-World War II architects in Switzerland.

entities.title: Hallenstadion
entities.description: The Hallenstadion is a multi-purpose facility located in the quarter of Oerlikon in northern Zürich. It is home to the ZSC Lions of the National League (NL) and has a capacity of 11,200 spectators. Designed by Bruno Giacometti, it opened on November 4, 1939, and was renovated in 2004–05.

heading: Births
txt: Shivaram Rajguru, Indian activist (d. 1931)

entities.title: Shivaram Rajguru
entities.description: Shivaram Hari Rajguru was an Indian revolutionary from Maharashtra, known mainly for his involvement in the assassination of a British Raj police officer. He also fought for the independence of India and on 23 March 1931 he was hanged by the British government along with Bhagat Singh and Sukhdev Thapar.

heading: Births
txt: Ronnie Grieveson, South African cricketer and soldier (d. 1998)

entities.title: Ronnie Grieveson
entities.description: Ronald Eustace Grieveson OBE was a South African cricketer who played in two Tests in 1938–39. He was born and died in Johannesburg, South Africa. He attended Parktown Boys' High School in 1922 and thereafter attended St John's College, Johannesburg from 1923 until 1926 where he matriculated.

heading: Births
txt: Durward Kirby, American television host and announcer (d. 2000)

entities.title: Durward Kirby
entities.description: Homer Durward Kirby was an American television host and announcer. He is best remembered for The Garry Moore Show in the 1950s and Candid Camera, which he co-hosted with Allen Funt from 1961 through 1966. His name is sometimes misspelled "Durwood".

heading: Births
txt: Charles Snead Houston, American physician and mountaineer (d. 2009)

entities.title: Charles Snead Houston
entities.description: Charles Snead Houston was an American physician, mountaineer, high-altitude investigator, inventor, author, film-maker, and former Peace Corps administrator. He made two important and celebrated attempts to climb the mountain K2 in the Karakoram Range.

heading: Births
txt: Wynonie Harris, American singer and guitarist (d. 1969)

entities.title: Wynonie Harris
entities.description: Wynonie Harris was an American blues shouter and rhythm-and-blues singer of upbeat songs, featuring humorous, often ribald lyrics. He had fifteen Top 10 hits between 1946 and 1952. Harris is attributed by many music scholars to be one of the founding fathers of rock and roll. His Good Rocking Tonight is especially mentioned at least as a precursor to rock and roll.

heading: Births
txt: James Tiptree, Jr., American psychologist and author (d. 1987)

heading: Births
txt: Dennis James, American game show host (d. 1997)

entities.title: Dennis James
entities.description: Dennis James was an American television personality, philanthropist, and commercial spokesman. Up until 1976, he had appeared on TV more times and for a longer period than any other television star. Alternately referred to as "The Dean of Game Show Hosts" and the "Godfather of Gameshows", he is credited as the host of television's first network game show, the DuMont Network's Cash and Carry (1946)

heading: Births
txt: Sikander Bakht, Indian field hockey player and politician, Indian Minister of External Affairs (d. 2004)

entities.title: Sikander Bakht
entities.description: Sikander Bakht was an Indian politician belonging to the Indian National Congress, the Janata Party and, finally, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). He was elected as the Vice President of the BJP, served its leader in the Rajya Sabha, and as a cabinet minister in the NDA government headed by Atal Bihari Vajpayee. In 2000, he was awarded Padma Vibhushan, the second highest civilian honour of the Go

entities.title: Minister of External Affairs (India)
entities.description: The Minister of External Affairs is the head of the Ministry of External Affairs of the Government of India. One of the senior-most offices in the Union Cabinet, the chief responsibility of the Foreign Minister is to represent India and its government in the international community. The Foreign Minister also plays an important role in determining Indian foreign policy. Occasionally, the Foreign Mi

heading: Births
txt: Tosia Altman, member of the Polish resistance in World War II (d. 1943)

entities.title: Tosia Altman
entities.description: Tosia Altman was a courier and smuggler for Hashomer Hatzair and the Jewish Combat Organization (ŻOB) during the German occupation of Poland and the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.

heading: Births
txt: J. Gordon Edwards, American entomologist, mountaineer, and DDT advocate (d. 2004)

heading: Births
txt: Enrique Llanes, Mexican wrestler (d. 2004)

heading: Births
txt: Alex Colville, Canadian painter and academic (d. 2013)

entities.title: Alex Colville
entities.description: David Alexander Colville, was a Canadian painter.

heading: Births
txt: Eric Simms, English ornithologist and conservationist (d. 2009)

entities.title: Eric Simms (ornithologist)
entities.description:
Eric Arthur Simms, 
DFC was an English ornithologist, naturalist, writer, sound recordist, broadcaster and conservationist, as well as a decorated wartime Bomber Command pilot/ bomb-aimer.

heading: Births
txt: Sam Tingle, English-Zimbabwean race car driver (d. 2008)

heading: Births
txt: René Lévesque, Canadian journalist and politician, 23rd Premier of Quebec (d. 1987)

entities.description: René Lévesque was a Québécois politician and journalist who served as premier of Quebec from 1976 to 1985, the 23rd since Confederation. heading: Births
txt: Juan Pedro Lanzani, Argentinian actor and singer

entities.title: Juan Pedro Lanzani
entities.description: Juan Pedro Lanzani , also known as Peter Lanzani, is an Argentine actor of cinema, theater and television, a former child model, and a singer. He is best known for his role on the Cris Morena television series Casi Ángeles playing 'Thiago Bedoya Agüero', and as a member of the music group Teen Angels. He is also known for his roles in Chiquititas Sin Fin and El Clan by Pablo Trapero.

heading: Births
txt: Wang Zhen, Chinese race walker

entities.title: Wang Zhen (racewalker)
entities.description: Wang Zhen is a Chinese race walker who specialises in the 10 kilometres and 20 kilometres race walk. He holds the senior Asian record for the 20 km with his time of 1:17:36 hours and is also the Asian, Chinese and junior world record holder over 10 km. He was the bronze medallist over 20 km at the 2012 London Olympics and the gold medallist at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

entities.description: Jemerson de Jesus Nascimento, known simply as Jemerson, is a Brazilian footballer who plays as a central defender for Brazilian Serie A club Corinthians.

heading: Births
txt: Allen Robinson, American football player

entities.title: Allen Robinson
entities.description: Allen Bernard Robinson II is an American football wide receiver for the Chicago Bears of the National Football League (NFL). He was drafted by the Jacksonville Jaguars in the second round of the 2014 NFL Draft, and played for the Jaguars for four seasons before signing with the Bears in 2018. He played college football at Penn State.

entities.description: Lady Amelia Sophia Theodora Mary Margaret Windsor is an English fashion model and a relative of the British royal family. She is currently 41st in the line of succession to the British throne, as of March 2021.
